Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Superb Resolution, Instant Booting, Good Battery, Love The Apps
Cons: Safari Pages Do Not Always Correctly Load, Navigation Between Screens Not Intuitive, Embedded Browser Graphs Absent
Apple has done a superb job with the hardware on this tablet. The resolution is superb, especially on YouTube videos that were filmed in HD. Simply amazing at times.
The tablet is easy to hold, tilts easily and quickly between portrait and landscape mode and then back again (360 degree titling almost instantly). The boot time and shutdown time are both the fastest that i have ever seen on a computing device, be it PC or smartphone or tablet. It is almost instantaneous. The battery life has surprised me...I have yet to run it down to nothing. It only has one speaker, but the qualit ... y is above average and it is a lot louder than what I expected. It is at least as loud as the Harman Kardon speakers in my laptop.
So what could be improved ?
1. The user interface and navigation between screens inside a number of the apps is NOT always intuitive. It may be easy to advance pages, but difficult to back up to previous pages. I could simply not figure out how to back up while in some of the apps (no back arrow) and had to exit to the main screen via the bottom button., and then re-enter the home page of the app. Really annoying.
2. Safari pages load correctly most of the time, but not always. Some of the time I am missing characters on the page that show up in the exact same page on my PC browser.
3. Some embedded, interactive graphics in website pages do NOT load at all. For instance, the webpage may have a click-on graph that is accessible when I click on it on my PC browser, but it loads as a blank area on the webpage on the iPAD.
4. Don't plan on playing very many Youtube videos. The iPAD only offers a subset of those available from a PC. One would think it would be because many videos do not support mobile, but I can play these same videos from my Android smartphone, so that argument is not valid. What's up with this ? Many videos don't even show up when searched for. I end up having to go back to my PC to play them.
In summation, Apple got it right about the hardw ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen Quality, Battery, App Store, iOS 5
Cons: Price
Ease of Use: iOS 5 has been built for ease of use. Very intuitive and easy to pick up and learn. Very few people that pick up an iPad don't know how to navigate through the operating system with ease. Couple that with an easy to understand app store and music/video store and content is just as easy to understand and watch. It's not customizable more than changing the background and lock pictures, but this, also, helps with the ease of use.
Features: One of the most exciting and interesting features is present with the AirPlay feature. This allows certain apps to push their content to AirPlay devices. You could be watching a movie; with the push of a button it pops up onto a screen with an Apple TV connected to ... it. The same goes for music and photos present on the iPad. Other AirPlay devices, such as speakers allow for you to push your music content to other speakers around the house. iCloud is another amazing feature. This allows you to sync content on Macs and PC's to your Apple mobile devices wirelessly. As long as you are connected to an internet source (in some cases just WiFI), you can have access to all your contacts, emails, and use the location finding service Find my iPhone. iTune's Match is also cool ($15 a year). This allows you access to your iTunes library in the cloud. It isn't stored locally on the iPad until you play it. But even if you delete it off your device, you still have access to it. Just play it again and it will again download to your device.
Screen Quality: This is what you are buying the 3rd generation iPad for. I upgraded from a 2nd generation, and was blown away by the clarity of the new display. Especially while zoomed, text and photos are very crisp and clean. eBooks are just that much easier to read on The New iPad.
Value for Price: Compared to the leading Android tablet, this thing has access to every single app on the App Store. Unlike the Android devices which may not be compatible with every app. Apps are what allow your devic ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen Resolution
Cons: Weight
When I was in the market for a tablet, I had no intention of getting an iPad. I was going to purchase either the Asus or Galaxy Tab2. As I was looking at these two tablets, I noticed the iPad area and decided to see what was such a big deal about these tablets. As soon as I opened the sleep cover, I was amazed at the screen resolution. Even the colors jumped off the screen. I then started doing an earnest comparison between the iPad and the others. The greatest thing that stood out was the resolution quality of small print. If you haven't seen an iPad before, you will think the others are very good; when you see the iPad (small print) you will then see a real difference. Much sharper and crisper. Even scrolling was much smoother t ... han the other tablets. The others had a slight lag whereas the iPad was smooth as silk. This and the Retina display were the deciding factors for me. The power hunger of the retina display caused Apple to install a larger battery. This has added to the weight and although not a nuisance, it is heavier than the others.
I have had my iPad for about a month and it continues to WOW me. Very easy to use and performs well. Don't hesitate in getting it. You will NOT be disappointed. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review: I got the New iPad to replace my iPad 2 because I am trying to get by without a notebook by using a wireless keyboard with the ipad. The main improvement is the Retina display which makes text much more clear and easier to read. The New iPad is noticably thicker and heavier than the iPad 2, but not terribly so, it still feels comfortable to hold and use. If you don't already know, the new iPad has the same CPU as the iPad 2, but the GPU (for graphics processing/video/games) is 2x as powerful. For non-nerds, the new iPad has all the speed and fluidity most people will ever want. For tech nerd types, sometimes when loading iPhoto or other heavy apps, it will take a moment of waiting, but overall, it is fine.I bought an Apple Wireless Keyboard to use with the new iPad. With iWork (pages, numb ... ers, and keynote), I can do most the of the productivity stuff I used to do on my Windows 7 laptop. In fact, iWork for iPad is easier to use than MS Office, so some stuff, particularly Excel sheets, are easier on the iPad. The high res display makes all the text much nicer on the new iPad. Making word documents is a snap, and by using the Apple Digital AV Adapter, I can hook up to an HDTV and give powerpoint classes/lectures using my ipad. Very nice to have a tiny tablet rather than a 6-8lb laptop.I chose the 32gb model over the 16gb because many apps on the new iPad take up more space due to the higher resolution. Battery life is similar to the iPad 2. Photos look beautiful on the new screen, but not amazingly better than the iPad 2. Asside from text, the Retina display is not as amazing as I thought it would be. By not having a laptop, I am forced to push the iPads productivity capabilities to the limit, and I am impressed. Uploading photos to photobucket is much easier and faster than via a windows laptop (even with an SSD). Also the camera on the New iPad is superior, so you can quickly shoot a photo for an online auction or [@], upload it to photobucket, and post your add very quickly. Doing it on a computer would require connecting a camera or phone, transfering files, uploading, etc. I can make a [@]add with a photo in about 2 minutes using the iPad. iPhoto is very impressive also. I took pictures of my house, which I am selling, on my iphone. They automatically appear on the iPad via Photo Stream. Then I edited the photos on the iPad, and uploaded them to Photo Journal on iCloud. Now I have a beautiful photo gallery on the internet to show potental buyers. I had never used the app before and is was very easy to do. I highly recommend it.I was able to use my iPad 2 case because it is a removable hard sleeve but the edges have some give. My wifes Speck case would not fit though. Even though the New iPad has the same shape as the ipad 2, the extra tiny bit of thickness will make most ipad 2 cases unusable. Smart covers still work fine though.In short, the iPad has arrived. With iWork, iPhoto, and a wireless keyboard, your laptops days are numbered. expand » « collapse

The only con about the iPad is the battery charge takes forever to recharge (about 8+ hours to fully charge via wall outlet), and most computers cannot supply enough power to charge the iPad without special programs that can bump up ... the voltage via the USB port. Luckily the battery lasts pretty long on the iPad even with frequent use (approximately 10 hours). All in all the iPad is expensive, but I think you get what you pay for! expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: A nice improvement but more could have been given
Item.Review:

Minus the need for increased memory, there little to not like about this device. For aging eyes, the screen resolution alone was worth the purchase price. With so many more pixels, I expected a flaw or two but there were none. They may develop over time but a multi-colored background will hide it. It does run a little hotter at times but that is expected due to the maintenance of such a hi-res screen. Some don't seem to like this but it will always be a necessary reality when devices like this push the envelope upward. If you don't like the heat, get an external cooler and enjoy the screen.
Battery life is nothing short of phenominel.
It's price is high an ... d it was difficult justifying it when owning a prefectly good and equivalent iPad 2. To me, the lack of the iPhone's 8mp camera and Siri are strong indicators that Apple has slowed down in making significant advances in reasearch and development while they leave room to make us buy yet another version of this device to own improvements that are already in the market.
One has to also wonder if their 4g electronics of this iPad is based on the 48 or 32 nm specs. That will have a lot to do with battery life.
I passed on the 4g ipad since I pay Verizon for unlimited 4g teathering on my Android phone. It's an older plan but the iPad connects to my phone flawlessly. In this configuration, I can even do 4g facetime. Now, if we could just have Siri; the biggest disappointing omission of this device. And what happened to their faster A6 CPU?
The camera is a welcome improvement but it is lackluster since the iPhone already does better. Now you know why I feel like I am beeing played.
At the end of the day, I bought the iPad 3 64 it for the screen resolution and to double my memory. Other than that, it is functionally the same as my iPad 2 but with a better camera which I don't use that anyway. When I want to take a picture, I use a real camera or my 8mp Android phone.
Oh, and Apple just dropped several of my favorite ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen Quality is great
Cons: Extremely slow internet connection
I bought my ipad on release day primary for internet surfing. I loved the compact size, light weight, and the screen quality; however, the internet connection is horrible (I mean EXTREMELY TERRIBLE!) It takes an hour to watch a video on youtube. The bar just spins, spins. My husband can finish watching a movie, and I will be watching the same five minutes of the video downloaded so far. It doesn't matter where I am in the house, the connect is still horrible. The youtube screen, the play button, forward button, and the backforward button are placed too closely together, there were many times, I accidentally pushed the wrong button while trying to pause the video. It just makes more sense to me to put th ... ese buttons further away from each other to avoid mis-pushing buttons of sorts. The camera quality at night is not so good, but I don't think it's meant to take pictures at night; however, the quality is good during the day. I am actually quite annoyed that there is only one speaker on one side, and the fact that the speaker faces backward instead of forward. Sometimes, I find myself cupping my hand on the speaker to try to direct the sound to the front, so I can hear better, then again, you can always wear a headphone to avoid this problem. I have not time it yet, but the battery time might not be close to 10 hours. My battery seems to run out sooner than the stated 10 hours. Overall, the ipad defeats my purpose, I can watch more videos on our dinosaur-era laptop than the cool ipad. Yes, the ipad is beautiful, but it's not working for me. expand » « collapse

In a side by side comparison I noted the following: Movies-Somewhat better quality on ipad 3. iBooks-Books open smoothly on ipad 2, jittery on ipad 3. If you look really closely on full zoom, you can just barely see display grid on ipad 2, not noticeable on ipad 3. Text was just as sharp on ipad 2 as ipad 3. Backlight on ipad 3 is a comfortable warm color, on ipad 2 its more like a flourescent light. General performance- No difference noticed. Ease of use- identical of course. Camera- Did not see enough of a difference to say which was better. Battery overheating issue-No over ... heating on ipad 3, felt no different than ipad 2. PROS: Somewhat better movie quality over ipad 2 More comfortable reading light over ipad 2 CONS: Performance, iBook use lighting, movie quality not improved enough to justify upgrade at $500. Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Apps; RETINA display; weight compared to a laptop PC; instant connectivity on network
Cons: Little pricey
I purchased this for myself to use at work primarily. I am a Senior Engineering Manager who finds my work schedule filled with meetings and design reviews. I have a company issued Dell laptop that I would take to meetings but with a battery life of 3 hours or so, I was looking for a lighter weight device with longer battery life to keep connected to my Outlook email and calendar while in those meetings which this iPad does great! With some free software (Citrix Receiver), I am able to have my iPad connect to our network inside our firewall and have access to our secure intranet and my network directories and files. I am able to even run the Microsoft Office pr ... oducts from our network servers remotely through this connection. So while I don’t try to create Office content on the iPad, I can view Office documents, Excel spreadsheets/charts/graphs, PowerPoint presentations, Visio Drawings, and Project schedules in their native format.
The main thing that I love about using my iPad at work is that it is on immediately. No waiting for the OS to slowly turn-on and connect to the website (like my laptop). I just launch the one app, put in my user name and password, and I am up and running. I like using the bevy of apps, especially for travel. I use it at home to stream music on Pandora and check in on Facebook.
I also purchased a 16GB iPad for my wife at the same time as this purchase for her to use to use at home and when we travel. We have had both iPads now for over 6 months and still love them and use them every day.
Great Product – Little Pricey, but worth the Value. expand » « collapse

Cons: The battery drains before my eyes, even turning off non-essentials
So the screen is crystal clear but if you don't decrease the brightness it sucks the battery far too fast. Even turning off non-essentials the battery life is terrible. I would not have purchased had I known. Plus, the battery takes a very long time to recharge.
I had the iPad 1 and loved it and usually wait to purchase upgrades until two generations above my current Apple product. I must express deep disappointment over this. Not sure it would even last a 4 hour flight.
Sorry I made the purchase. Should have waiting until they got the battery figured out.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything. Love it.
Cons: Wish it were 3G compatible, without having to use personal hotspot.
A great device. Easy to use, but again wish for 3 g capabilities for price.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: It's a blessing for my workplace meetings and othe
Item.Review:
Pros: Compact size ( cmpared to the laptop), ease of use.
Cons: Screen is difficult to see in glare or bright light.
I wish I had purchased one of these when they first came out. It's terriffic.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: You pay more because it's an iPad & worth it.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set-up and use.
Cons: Nothing.
Having all i-products is the way to go, from iPhone to the iMac, now adding the NEW iPad just completes the trio. Everything is sync-ed together making your experience wonderful. With most of the business establishments having wifi, the new iPad is portable enough to bring anywhere. With its long lasting battery, you can go hours without worrying. The camera is just great, beautiful pictures. You pay more for this item, but it's well worth it.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, good size screen, excellent sound and graphics, nice to keep by my chair and not miss emails.
Cons: I got a gel cover right away for home use, and a smart cover as the device is quite slippery.
Everything in one compact product, email, access to movies, GPS, calendar, contacts, make video calls, alarm clock to wake you up or send reminders for appointments, games in HD, camera, video camera, easy to use pop up keyboard, you can hook up a glucose meter and download an app to keep tract if you are diabetic, note pad, so many useful tools to make life so much easier! I highly recommend the iPad!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: The camera is so much better than the Ipad 2
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything compared to the Ipad 2
Cons: I wish it had a light to tell you when the battery was charged. Also I wish it had a longer battery charge.
The camera is beautiful, the movies and games are picture perfect. I am glad I made the upgrade. I almost waited for the next one, but with the trade value of my Ipad 2 it just made since to do it now.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: streaming between mac and ipad
This is my first iPad and I love it! It is easy to use and I love that you can stream between the mac desktop and the iPad (I love having all my pictures instantly on the iPad). My 3 1/2 year old also has games downloaded on it already and he uses it without difficulty. The battery life is much better than I expected!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice improvements on the Gen 3 but
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice screen
Cons: Cost and slippery
There are some nice improvements in the gen 3 iPad, but it doesn't seem to go much faster than the gen 1. The screen is nicer, but still very prone to smears and smudges. The camera is very good and takes nice pictures, but it is awkward to hold. It is very slippery and easy to drop without some kind of case which negates the slimmer lines.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review: Following some research and talking to others with tablets (Apple and Android), I decided to go for the iPad (3rd gen). I am very pleased with my purchase. Crisp graphics, great sound and a pleasure to navigate around. Thank you Apple!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast, fun and easy to use. Perfect size.
Cons: Nothing, it's all great!
It's great to check emails, play games, surf the web, and even watch movies and programs. I love that it is fast and no set up involved. I don't have a lot of time to mess around with setting up a PC. I love my new iPad!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen
Cons: Learning curve
Received as a gift and I'm not a full apple convert yet so there is a learning curve. Otherwise the screen is fantastic for movies. Size makes it easy to pack and travel with. 32GB is a good size so far...lots of apps and haven't made a dent in the storage space.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use.
Cons: Won't display some web material due to Flash issue.
The iPad was everything I expected. Stunning graphics, easy to use, but with issues with certain web sites not displaying Flash graphics and some photos on web sites but I knew this going in. I still finding myself wanting to 'File/Save' but the iPad doesn't work like that. Still looking for a decent Financial Planning app (which doesn't want to store my personal financial data on a server somewhere) or a good spreadsheet. I need Office 2010 for iPad but there are workaround apps. Not quite a PC yet, but I can just pick it up and check my e-mail or quickly surf without having to wait for a long boot up or wait for the latest 'update' to download and install itself! My two girls love playing games on ... it - so I have often have to wait my turn! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Sweet machine for everyday normal use
Item.Review: I use it for some minor games, reading magazines, internet access (wifi) on trips and watching movies. Quick start up, light weight, easy to take with me. I wanted to use it for iTunes as well but it needs more memory for that so look for that in later versions.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: The screen is beautiful and its so easy to use
Cons: Its farely pricey
I love my iPad. I had to save a bit to get the one I wanted but it was worth the price. I love what I can do with the iPad. I am very impressed. There are so many great applications. I can really see the convergence between laptop and tablet. My kids love the iPad also. They make there own cartoons! The tablet screen responds great. It holds a charge for quite awhile compared to my Samsung Android tablet. Of course it plays my music and movies just fine. I definitely recommend this product.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great item for beginners as well
Item.Review:
Pros: Light, battery, easy to use
Cons: A pain if you need to write e-mails.
Great item. Love it! Very light and battery charge last about 2, maybe 2 and a half days. Still trying to load it up with some cool apps.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: I love the iPad. It is truly the best.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, Fun to use, The screen is mind blowing, Fun apps, Connectivity, Actually its too many to list.
Cons: Expensive but worth it...should have been more Storage at this price tag, Have to wait for Siri in iOS 6
I was one of those people that said "I don't need a iPad, I have a Laptop / PC Desktop / Smartphone." There wasn't a need for a tablet in my life but it would have been nice to catch up with the world in the direction technology is moving. So over the course of years I always dismissed iPad because of it's price. I bought MANY Android Tablets and taking them back because I was disappointed with Issues. Here is a list:
- Elocity A7 tablet - Samsung Galaxy Tab - Dell Streak 7 - Archos (few of those) - HTC Flyer - Eee Pad Transformer ... >- Xoom - Samsung Galaxy Tab 10.1 - Samsung Galaxy Tab 7.0+
Now all of them wasn't bad tablets, they just wasn't working properly after a while. So after all that I gave up on tablets period. I decided that since I have a now Android phone (Samsung Galaxy Note) It was time to just save and bite the bullet on a iPad....
Now I question myself...Why did I wait so long to buy one?!?!
This tablet is amazing, It truly a remarkable device. I can see why Apple get's praised for making a device this good and this fluent. While I understand both iOS and Android is different and each it's own (There are some things Android and iOS do better then one another.) but "The New iPad" is leaps and bounds over most tablets that I've tried here is why:
Screen:
Bright and Vibrant HD Visuals. It's crisp and sharp and reading on this thing is Phenomenal. This is eye candy (or iCandy) pure eye candy to anyone who is a fan of a HD display. Unlike the iPad 2 which I tried at the demo at store there is no way I can go back to a lower resolution tablet due to the fact I am spoiled by this screen. The games look amazing as well. Honestly its like the screen isn't there.
Speed:
Quick...So quick in everything it does. Web browsing is super fast, Opening apps is super fast, Doing anything is fast. I never owned a iPad 2 so I can't compare the two but I am very happy with it.
Apps:
Good apps are in the app store. Almost anything your looking for its almost certai ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: iOS still hands down the simplest to use for the general mass
Cons: price, UI might be stale after 3 straight years
Great product overall. This by no means is the do-it-all tablet, but as far as tablets go, is amazing for what it does. The main point, of course, is the screen quality. Soon as you boot it up, you will see how gorgeous it is. Other than that, the App Store is second to none for apps, and usually the best quality if there are equivalents on other app stores (mainly Google Play for Android). Since I've gotten this, I use my laptop and desktop about 30-40% of the time then before. Most basic things can be done with this tablet. I've used Android tablets before, and I must say it is great for the hackers and the more tech-oriented mass, but all in all, if ... the average joe would want to get into tablets, you can't go wrong with iPad! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, screen
Cons: price and memory is ridiculous
As I own a Nikon D7000, and a 17" macpro, I use the laptop for all my photo processing. I bought the iPhone 1 the month they came out, been a firm apple guy since, put off buying an iPad until now, the reason I finally caved? The retina display of course, I feel this iPad will be a strong player in the photo community, but one big problem is the memory, 16 gigs is a joke, it's as big as my phone, other makers offer USB ports to easily move pic or whatever to or fro, so as I am writing this I just pulled 1100 pictures off the macpro onto a 250g storage cell, but now it's a pain to send,edit or otherwise "get" to those pics. ( if u leave them on laptop they get synced unless u don't want too, it's a big reason I got an app ... le, so everything synced, so I dont want to throttle my pics back, I just informed wife I may have to return this device, and get the 32gig, anyone into pictures or video u will need the bigger drive. Because I have an IPhone4g with 16gigs, when I did first sync I ended up with 2 gigs free, due to "using" my iPhone I usually have it pretty filled, which in turn fills your iPad. So I guess if you like me have the new iPhone then the entry level iPad just isn't big enough ( memory wise) I bought every accessory made for the iPad too, I can say I really liked the dock, but after buying the Logitech thin keyboard case ($99) I can say its not needed now, u can stand it in the keyboard spot while charging. The thin keyboard cover by Logitech is excellent, works flawlessly, feels really good to type, and has nice features. I know this is for iPad, but I am so impressed by the thin keyboard cover, not the regular thicker one for $79, that I could easily return the dock, and the folding cover, that's about $80, and then get the 32gig iPad for basically $20 more out of pocket vs $100. Also, this is an ITunes product, with a lot of emphasis on, you know, music and recording and editing, and it has one lousy speaker? Ok, for only one tiny speaker it's OK at best ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Battery life, resolution, fast resoonse
Cons: Honestly nothing yet!!!
I love this tablet. I do have to say when it comes to cell phones I am a android all the way but tablets and computers apple 100%. I got the new iPad and the quality is awesome. Well worth the 499.99. Sure you could buy a kindle fire for less but if you want something that will last and be up to date go for this iPad. The battery life is a 10/10 I use my a lot for Facebook and games for my son and I think mine does way more then the 10 hours it says it lasts. It is very fluent and absolutely no lag that I have seen. Light weight, not that much different from the iPad 2 weight. I can only say good things about this iPad. Apple you did great. Thanks
I have to add. I bought the otterbox defender b ... ecause I wanted to be sure it was safe in the hands of my 2 1/2 year old(he plays a few learning games) and even with the case it's not extremely bulky. I'm happy with it. But does make it a lil heavier. But I would rather it be heavy then in a flimsy case that if drop it would probably break. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Just love everything about the IPad
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use... even for 68 yr old...so much fun.
Cons: Have to get out of previous apps to save battery.
This still very new to me... my grandson is teaching me so much and I am enjoying learning......beautiful picture and easy to type messages. Love the face to face phone visiting. So many apps to choose from. Easy to carry around and no long set up time as a computer is.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: so easy to use you can learn tricks about it on your own
Cons: its a little heavy
the battery life is great. the resolution and the things you can do o it are nice as well. i would recommend this to a friend its like having a small computer that you can use any were.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: It is easy to set up and download apps.
Cons: The price was quite exorbitant, and many of the apps I need are expensive.
The IPad is a fantastic product, easy to use, and quite convenient to tote.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use
Cons: Nothing
I need to use this on the road to write reports. Pages works well and I can transfer them to word docs via e- mail. Also have another word app that works well. Great battery life and works great on a plane. I thought I would miss my laptop but this does the trick and I don't have to lug it around anymore. I also did not think that I could use the keyboard because of my big hands but it works great. That is the main reason I picked this over an android tablet. Hope this info helps others and have a great day.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy keyboard, wonderful resolution, very easy to sync with other apple products
Cons: Not all of the web sites load well, or are compatible. Not great for lots of word processing/editing.
Love it! User friendly, light weight, good for traveling and commuting.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: The resolution
Cons: Nothing
I originally bought the 16gb Ipad2 but after reading the reviews for the New Ipad, I went back to Best Buy and exchanged it for the 32gb New Ipad. I'm glad I did. I love the resolution/clarity.
The only thing that I was slightly disappointed about was the limitation of not being able to use this to replace my laptop due to the lack of word processing or excel software. Well QuickOffice solved that problem. Now I can't think of anything that I would consider a negative.
If you can afford the extra $ for the New Ipad, buy it. just remember that the apps made for the New Ipad take up more memory due to the greater resolution so go for the higher capacity.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: My laptop is horribly neglected as a result of this purchase
Wonderful product, amazing screen resolution. I now use the iPad for everyday use instead of my laptop. There is no time needed to boot-up and the battery life is great. To quote Ferris Bueller, "If you have the means...I highly recommend picking one up."

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Intuitive interface is the industry high-water mark.
Cons: Needs to include a stylus with a $500 purchase.
Great display. Apple's interface is the simple to figure out and use. You will be spoiled quickly compared to any other touch screen device. The apps available are an amazing collection, constantly growing and improving.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy to use even for a beginner.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use
Cons: iPad locks up, high price, screen smears easily, keyboard should have arrow left/right keys.
Can be used even by a newbie. The iPad should come with a cover of some type to protect its large glass screen other than a cardboard box.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review: The new I Pad was a big step for me. Overall, I really like it. It is reasonbly intuitive to use. The screen resolution is great. It has a lot of features that I'm still trying to learn. Battery life seems pretty good. What I don't like is that there are web functions, mostly small things, that I can't do. I also don't like the fact that it did not come with the "pages" app.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: This is my third iPad, and I love it
Item.Review:
Pros: Carry it easily anywhere. Get email, internet, and read with ease
Cons: Not nearly as easy to move files around and download as Windows
I am very pleased with the new iPad. I particularly needed the 64 Gb size machine. I have some irritations with the Apple IOS, but the actual using of the iPad is great. It is only cumbersome to download data or move data to various apps.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Very convenient and easy to take with.
Item.Review:
Pros: The size is awesome and its easy to use.
Cons: Pretty pricey for what it is.
Although I've had this I-pad a bit over a month I feel as though I learn something new every time I use it. The screen is vivid and its very user-friendly for the most part. I purchased it through Best Buy, because it was the best buy. I haven't used an Apple since the late '90s and there are some differences but, for the most part I like it. I am somewhat of a technological dinosaur, and it has responded to nearly every task. I think if you use it for email, surfing the net, or playing games its fine though, its no replacement for a PC in my honest opinion.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use and a tremondous number of apps.
Cons: Glare from the screen
I have been waiting for a couple of years trying to decide on an ereader or the iPad. When the new version came out I was ready to purchase an iPad 2 since teh prices were dropping. When I looked and used the new iPad I was blown away. It is very easy to use, and the number of apps is overwhelming. I still have ont gotten through all the apps and have focused on apps to apply to work. If you are looking for more than just a reader, something that can be used for work, the iPad is fantastic. A little pricey, but I found it to be well worth it so far.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review: The best product of the 20'past years! Easy to handle, fast to surf on the Internet, perfect to send a quick email while travelling, great to watch a movie in the plane, this iPad is simply amazing! And on the contrary to my iPhone, the iPad battery does last long! Just buy it to discover go great it is. I was wondering why people loved their iPad before getting one, but I'm not addicted!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Display, easy to navigate
Cons: Price
Great quality stuff from Apple. It filled the gap between my laptop and smartphone. My aged parents find it easier to use that than a complex PC

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Product/Battery Life is not as good as prev.
Item.Review:
Pros: Apps, Ease of Use, Crisp clear Images, Great Camera
Cons: Baterry LIfe
This Ipad is GREAT! THe only thing I didnt like about it is that the battery life drains quickly......not like the previous ipads. BUt i guess since this Ipad has more to it (not that much) I guess it's processors work more. That is my only complaint about the item other than that GO BUY ONE!! I carry mine all the time...

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy to set up and use
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy set up, awesome clarity
Cons: Not Flashplayer compatible
This is my first experience with a tablet. I'm not a high-tech person, but I like gadgets. Set up was very easy, and downloading apps from iTunes is a snap. In addition to the fabulous screen resolution, it's much easier than carrying around a laptop.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, great value, AWESOME screen quality
Cons: Fingerprints...but that's gonna happen unless you use a stylus 100%
Was looking at another brand of tablet when I noticed its price was the same as this NEW BETTER iPad. The other had more memory, but I went with QUALITY. Screen resolution in HD.....The most amazing picture ever. I don't think there's anything bad to say about this. It takes some getting used to & learning a few new ways of doing things, but, that's just like anything new you buy. Love it & wouldn't trade it for anything......unless they make a newer better version & I'm sure they will :-) Thanking my wonderful husband for an awesome Mothers Day gift!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Good tablet for a new user
Item.Review:
Pros: Beautiful Screen, Light Weight, and the IPAD Class really helped
Cons: Battery life is less than advertised. Back and screen scrath easily.
IPAD's are pricey. This was an open box item, which helped on the budget. The IPAD class offered by our AZ Best Buy was very helpful and both guys who taught it helped me learn about my new IPAD. The unit does scratch easily, and you need to protect both the screen and back. Using a rubber tipped stylus really helps a lot!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review: I got this as a gift for my fiancee as a birthday present, and she loved it. She wanted something she can take with her while on the road to check emails and for entertainment to kill time. I'm very happy and pleased about it. The picture quality and the screen resolution is stunning! Everything is so much clearer than the previous ipad generations. The only thing I am worried about, and I haven't tested, are the overheating issues I've heard some users experienced with this new ipad 3. As well, I've heard about wifi issues others have experienced. Although I have used it lightly, I haven't had any issues connecting to my router and downloading and web surfing as of yet.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: long battery life
Cons: price
My wife has an ASUS tablet and the iPad is so much better than than tablet in terms of usability and app availability. Also the touch screen is so much more responsive.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: The Best Tablet on the Market
Item.Review: I highly recommend the new iPad. If you're looking for a great tablet to act like a cross between a pad of paper and a laptop, look no further. The screen in breathtakingly crisp. The touch screen is by far the best on the market. Apple was right when they said the battery can last for up to 10 hours. There is truly an app for just about anything. Easy to operate, and I don't have to carry around my massive laptop in order to do meanial things, like checking something on the internet. It's a beautiful suppliment to a computer. It's NOT A LAPTOP REPLACEMENT, but if you would like to take notes, become even more productive outside the office, show off your portfolio, play games, and/or consolidate files, the iPad (specifically, the new iPad) is the way to go.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Love the iPad 3. Had an iPad 2 and sold it for a 3
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything!! Particularly the screen resolution!
Cons: Nothing
Highly recommend it. Just took it on a long road trip and it made the trip so much better because we had so much information at our fingertips. Easy to use in daylight or dark. Love it!

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up E-Mail
Cons: Somewhat confusing to sync with Outlook.
Waited long enough for Apple to put out an iPad with feature sets that let me justify buying one. I was surprised at how easy some things were to set up (e-mail accounts) and how difficult it was to sync with Outlook.
Apple Tech Support was truly the finest phone support I have ever experienced and within 5 minutes my problem was resolved.
The iPad is rock solid and I have not had a hiccup or freeze yet.
I have started to leave my laptop at home and feel comfortable meeting clients with only the iPad.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good tool at home and at work...
Item.Review:
Pros: Definitely user friendly and easy to set up like all Apple products.
Cons: The cost
Great tool!!! I need to learn all the power I have at my fingertips...but so far it has been excellent. Wish the cost was a little less just from a budget standpoint.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Apple makes everything so easy to use
Cons: battery life is not as good as the prior generations, but still pretty decent
I bought the new iPad and love it! I'm a huge fan of Apple products because they are easy to use and are high quality. The main reason I wanted to upgrade to the new iPad is because I had the original version that did not have a camera lens and I wanted to use the FaceTime function. I was able to sell my original to subsidize the cost of the new one. If I wasn't able to sell it I probably would have waited until it didn't work so great and upgraded still, but it wouldn't have been this soon.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: vibrant display
Cons: heavy & takes 8 hr to fully charge
nice new ipad3, but heavy and takes forever to charge.
beware a lot of accessories that claim to be compatible for both ipad2 and ipad3 because they do not fit the thicker ipad3. in particular the Belkin back cover WILL NOT fit the ipad3.
speaker not loud enough, cannot connect to bluetooth headset when streaming movies from internet. love the wi-fi iMessage & Facetime.
like the Rocket fish stylus which is more precise that the Bamboo stylus that cost twice as much.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review: The new iPad has an amazing screen, really fast and keeps the amazing user interface I know and like... Setting it up and putting my apps was a breeze. It did gain a little weight though and is a bit heavier than previous models...

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: screen display, apps, size, many ways to use
Cons: price lol
its a great i pad, u can use it for everything school, business, games and so much more. great for military people like that need some entertainment when far away from home

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: First experience with an Apple product - love it.
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen quality is superb, easy on my old eyes.
Cons: After a lifetime of PC use, there's a bit of a learning curve to get up to speed.
My husband convinced me to get an IPad for my birthday. Once I got it home and all set up, he essentially comandeered it, saying I could just tell him whenever I wanted to use it. Since he is essentially home-bound due to ill health, I decided to let him have it and buy myself an IPod (I am most interested in portable music and Podcasts; he likes to 'surf' and play games). I got a wireless speaker, which works great with both devices. I am very satisfied with our current arrangement. My husband absolutely loves "his" IPad, and we are amazed at the technology. Screen clarity is amazing.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use, speed, screen display, set up, clarity, hooking up to outside soundbar via BT, functionality, and size.
Cons: Doesn't forecast lottery numbers.
Never thought I would get a IPAD but this is awesome, use it everywhere! Good bye computer.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review: I have owned my New iPad for a couple months and continue to learn new things about it. I'm amazed at how long the battery charge lasts. I do have a complaint about the camera. There is no zoom when set for video. I downloaded a free app that does do video zoom, but I would prefer to not have to switch from one app to another, Apple needs to upgrade the camera to have video zoom. I'm disappointed that I can't view movies through my Amazon Prime account nor can I watch tennis on Espn3. There have been a few times that I have not been able to view videos on certain websites nor some of the videos attached to emails sent to me I can do all of these things on my HP Netbook. A couple of other complaints regarding photos. It appears that we cannot label photos. Also there is a problem with editi ... ng. I created a couple new folders for photos and copied a photo from the camera roll. I cropped a photo in one of the folders and was disappointed to find that the copies of the photo in the other folder and in the camera roll were both cropped, not very useful if you wish to keep the original also. But, for the most part it is a lot of fun to use. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Versatility, Screen
Cons: Weight, Lack of USB or SD port
I love my iPad. I use it for almost everything now. I rarely touch my laptop unless I need to see something done in flash(which is getting rare these days) or ingest photos and videos. It's very versatile and for me the best thing to travel with.
My two main issues with it are weight and lack of ports. In regards to weight I find it a little heavy when holding it without some form of support. The size is perfect, but it gets uncomfortable when holding it like a book. If you're looking for something to just read books with, I would probably go with a kindle because it weighs almost nothing.
The lack of ports keeps this thing from truly being computer free. I would much rather be able to put in my came ... ras SD card to transfer images over then go to my computer and then pull them from the network. So if you travel and take lots of pictures you're still going to need a laptop to view them on the road.
A USB port to expand storage options, like a thumb drive would be awesome. Or to create some sort of "breakout" box to hook up other input devices would be good too.
I think the iPad has alot of potential to be a great laptop replacement, but it's just not there yet. However, it is a great overall device and I wouldn't trade mine for anything. The weight and lack of ports are the only reason I have it 4 stars instead of 5. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast loading web pages. Smooth operation. Clear images on high resolution material.
Cons: Price...Ouch! $700.00 for a piece of glass, aluminum and silicon.
My first tablet. I am glad I went with the Apple. Others are nice too, but the reputation speaks for itself and all the great reviews. I have the 4S in 64 GB too. Nice products, but again, costly.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review: I don't have an iPhone or Apple computer so when the new iPad came out, I decided it was about time I tried an Apple product. I have to admit that the cool factor helped me make my decision. It's very sleek - the screen is amazingly bright. I did have a bit of trouble getting an Apple ID and had to call their tech support for help. It was resolved easily. I use this product when I travel. It is easier to bring along than a laptop. I haven't been on a plane with it, but I've been told it can stay in your carry-on luggage during the security check without the hassle of a laptop. I also use it for reading - books and magazines. It's very fast - no lag on my home network or any other wireless area where I have travelled. My only problem is that you can not use Flash on an Apple product - ... and since most of my friends and family have Windows computers or laptops, I can't use Skype with them. This was something I didn't think about when I purchased it and might have thought twice knowing it didn't have an app I like to use. It's an expensive toy in a lot of ways, but I have been enjoying it. The newness hasn't worn off yet (I only got it last month - April 2012) and I hope it doesn't. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
A new, incredibly impressive new iPad from Apple.Screen resolution Retina impressive richness and clarity. After The New iPad is impossible to look at the iPad 2. Improved Camera 5MP, new quad-GPU A5X, an increased amount of RAM.
Apple iPad made perfect.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: The screen alone is worth every cent!
Item.Review:
Pros: Crystal clear browsing, reading
Cons: Nothing so far
5.0 out of 5 stars. I Took back iPad 2 for the "new" iPad ... and loving my decision!
I originally bought the iPad 2 to save some money, but I soon found myself disappointed in the quality of the text resolution for web browsing, reading books, etc. It bothered me so much that I took it back to Best Buy after 10 days for a refund.
While there, I played with the 3rd generation iPad and was immediately blown away by the higher resolution, and of course this is the big draw for this new iPad, the new screen. I immediately ordered the "new" iPad when I got home. In my opinion, it is totally worth the extra $ for a crystal clear display in all aspects of use. Don't bother with the iPad 2 unless a bit of fuzzi ... ness is ok with you for surfing or reading, or if the price is an issue. Aside from that, this 3rd gen iPad "seems" pretty much the same as the iPad 2 in most other aspects. Ok, it's slightly thicker & heavier than the ipad 2, but those things don't bother me in the least. The clarity alone was worth every extra cent...Loving it! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen and battery
Cons: None
Perfect tablet, easy to use for anyone. Hands down the best tablet for your money period. It is slightly more than some Android tablets but you get much more with this than you would with them. First, there is no match when it comes to developer/app support for Apple. Second and most importantly, Apple does not abandon their older models like Android manufacturers do. Apple releases the updates quickly, so does Google for Android but then you are stuck waiting for the individual manufacturers to then adapt it to their software. And if they have releases a newer device(which they do rather quickly) you are stuck waiting for an update to never come and are then stuck with good hardware but no software support. Beautiful screen, great battery ... life, tons of accessories to choose from, and a smooth, polished operating system. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:

Cons: No bad things that I've found yet.
This is an amazing product. I recommend this highly to anyone looking for a tablet. Great camera, excellent HD quality.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use, screen size and quality, fast.
Cons: Need more apps for higher resolution screen.
This is an excellent product. The screen size is a plus and the speed of the device is tremendous. The only drawback that I have at this time, is there are not enough apps to take advantage of the higher resolution Retina display. The commercials for the iPad 3 display brilliant pictures and colors, however, you will be hard pressed to find anything of that quality for yourself. It may take a couple of years before there is enough media content and apps that have the high resolution that this device deserves. This reminds me of being an early adopter of HD TV before there was enough HD programming.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Simplicity
Cons: Price
You can't do everything a laptop does but I prefer the iPad for the size, speed at startup and portability. I'm having so much fun with my new iPad, it's like my iPod Touch on steroids. I've already download about 200 free apps, my whole music collection of over 1600 songs and 12 of my digital copy movies. I'm endangering of filling this up but they didn't make a 128 GB model like they should have. Wish Apple did flash and wish it was cheaper but am very happy.

Battery life is awesome. I bought a WD network 2tb hard drive, so that I can stream movies on to my iPad as well

Nice device. Don't mix up your pad/pod/phone chargers. Ipad takes a very long time to charge if on the wrong charger. The slight warmth is not an issue. It must be the perfect size - half the time I think that larger would be better, the rest of the time, smaller would be better.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Not much different than the iPad2
Item.Review:
Pros: Definitely portable
Cons: Wish you could have it be a WiFi capable and 4G without having to buy 2 seperate items
Overall, not different then the iPad 2. Easy to use overall and something great for kids to play on. Having both 4G and WiFi capabilities would be great without having the extra charges. Cost is a little too high when compared to a Netbook as there is no real difference between what you can do between the two models.

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen and Tablet Apps
Cons: Phone apps do not look the best.
Recently I sold my 7 inch Samsung tablet for this upgrade and so far I've been very happy.
The screen is beautiful and many tablet apps have been upgraded to take advantage of it, but unfortunately the phone apps tend not to look the best.
There has been several articles about heat and wifi issues, which I have not experience anything worth complaining about. I feel the majority of these complaints are slightly exaggerated.
I do miss the smaller form factor of the 7 inch, being that I am mainly a bedroom/couch reader, the smaller tablet was a little bit more ideal. Easier to hold due to size and weight.
Also from using my friends Ipad 2, I would not say this is a must have upgrade. ... Though the new model has some nice features, the Ipad 2 is a very nice device.
I'd easily recommend this device to anyone, but if you have an Ipad 2 I would just enjoy that and if you're just looking for a device for some couch/bedroom reading it might be best to wait for the Ipad Mini or some other smaller device. expand » « collapse

Still a nice added feature though. I recently used the adapter for loading pictures into the IPAD and that worked beautifully, despite hearing some reviews that it didn't work. Overall I love this newest ver ... sion and am glad to have purchased it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Apple iPad Wi-Fi 16 GB - 3rd generation - Black
Item.ReviewTitle: Best pad yet but still being held back...
Item.Review:
Pros: Resolution, build, size, weight, - everything but the below.
Cons: NO FLASH and NO FLASH
Everyone knows this thing is great so I won't focus on that.
The small problem - still no flash for the camera. I know it seems petty but for the price and the fact this is the 3rd version, they really should have this built in by now.
The big problem - still no Flash functionality (i.e. Adobe Flash ability). Come on Apple, add the functionality already. It is just ridiculous that a tablet at this price and true ability does not have the full capability of what is possible. It is truly annoying that there are many websites that I cannot access and thus must pull out my laptop or just not have full function at those websites.
